title: Augusta County: Gerald E. Crist to his cousin Mary, March 18, 1862
summary: G. E. Crist writes to his cousin Mary about camp life in general, his worries about his mother, once the militia is called up. He also writes about his growing urge to fight and his faith that they will eventually win the war.
keywords: Camp Life, Enlistment, Home Front, Patriotism, Prisons/Prisoners, American Civil War
